CVE-2021-36260
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.48%

2 posts

A command injection vulnerability in the web server of some Hikvision product. Due to the insufficient input validation, attacker can exploit the vulnerability to launch a command injection attack by sending some messages with malicious commands.

9 repos

https://github.com/jorhelp/Ingram

https://github.com/Cuerz/CVE-2021-36260

https://github.com/rabbitsafe/CVE-2021-36260

https://github.com/tuntin9x/CheckHKRCE

https://github.com/r3t4k3r/hikvision_brute

https://github.com/haingn/HIK-CVE-2021-36260-Exploit

https://github.com/TakenoSite/Simple-CVE-2021-36260

https://github.com/Aiminsun/CVE-2021-36260

https://github.com/TaroballzChen/CVE-2021-36260-metasploit

simontsui at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.426Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesnâ€™t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

ðŸ”— https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

#7777Botnet #botnet #TPLink #Xiongmai #Hikvision #CVE202177577 #CVE201810088 #CVE202245460 #CVE202136260 #CVE202224355 #MVPower #Zyxel #GitLab

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.000Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesnâ€™t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

ðŸ”— https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

CVE-2017-9841
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.48%

2 posts

Util/PHP/eval-stdin.php in PHPUnit starting with 4.8.19 and before 4.8.28, as well as 5.x before 5.6.3, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via HTTP POST data beginning with a `

simontsui at 2024-01-16T17:14:18.401Z ##

Vulnerabilities mentioned in this CISA cybersecurity advisory:

  • CVE-2017-9841 (9.8 critical, disclosed 27 June 2017, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 February 2022) arbitrary PHP code execution in PHPUnit
  • CVE-2018-15133 (8.1 high, disclosed 09 August 2018, added to KEV 16 January 2024) Laravel Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability (RCE)
  • CVE-2021-41773 (7.5 high, disclosed 05 October 2021, added to KEV 03 November 2021) Apache HTTP Server Path Traversal Vulnerability (RCE)

#CVE201815133 #KEV #vulnerability #CVE20179841 #CVE202141773 #eitw #activeexploitation

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-16T17:14:18.000Z ##

Vulnerabilities mentioned in this CISA cybersecurity advisory:

  • CVE-2017-9841 (9.8 critical, disclosed 27 June 2017, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 February 2022) arbitrary PHP code execution in PHPUnit
  • CVE-2018-15133 (8.1 high, disclosed 09 August 2018, added to KEV 16 January 2024) Laravel Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability (RCE)
  • CVE-2021-41773 (7.5 high, disclosed 05 October 2021, added to KEV 03 November 2021) Apache HTTP Server Path Traversal Vulnerability (RCE)

CVE-2021-44228
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.47%

2 posts

# Summary Log4j versions prior to 2.16.0 are subject to a remote code execution vulnerability via the ldap JNDI parser. As per [Apache's Log4j security guide](https://logging.apache.org/log4j/2.x/security.html): Apache Log4j2 <=2.14.1 JNDI features used in configuration, log messages, and parameters do not protect against attacker controlled LDAP and other JNDI related endpoints. An attacker who

ntkramer at 2024-01-20T16:41:54.838Z ##

ðŸ¥¶ & #threatintel: There has been a significant increase in attempts to exploit a remote code execution vulnerability in the popular Java logging library Apache Log4j, identified as CVE-2021-44228 and CVE-2021-45046.

##

CVE-2021-45046
(9.0 None)

EPSS: 97.40%

2 posts

# Impact The fix to address [CVE-2021-44228](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-44228) in Apache Log4j 2.15.0 was incomplete in certain non-default configurations. This could allow attackers with control over Thread Context Map (MDC) input data when the logging configuration uses a non-default Pattern Layout with either a Context Lookup (for example, $${ctx:loginId}) or a Thread Context Ma

##

CVE-2021-41773
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.39%

2 posts

A flaw was found in a change made to path normalization in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.49. An attacker could use a path traversal attack to map URLs to files outside the expected document root. If files outside of the document root are not protected by "require all denied" these requests can succeed. Additionally this flaw could leak the source of interpreted files like CGI scripts. This issue is known

##

CVE-2022-47966
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.12%

2 posts

Multiple Zoho ManageEngine on-premise products, such as ServiceDesk Plus through 14003, allow remote code execution due to use of Apache xmlsec (aka XML Security for Java) 1.4.1, because the xmlsec XSLT features, by design in that version, make the application responsible for certain security protections, and the ManageEngine applications did not provide those protections.

##

CVE-2018-1000006
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.08%

1 posts

Affected versions of `electron` may be susceptible to a remote code execution flaw when certain conditions are met: 1. The electron application is running on Windows. 2. The electron application registers as the default handler for a protocol, such as `nodeapp://`. This vulnerability is caused by a failure to sanitize additional arguments to chromium in the command line handler for Electron. Mac

1 repos

https://github.com/CHYbeta/CVE-2018-1000006-DEMO

##

CVE-2023-22527
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.05%

32 posts

A template injection vulnerability on older versions of Confluence Data Center and Server allows an unauthenticated attacker to achieve RCE on an affected instance. Customers using an affected version must take immediate action. Most recent supported versions of Confluence Data Center and Server are not affected by this vulnerability as it was ultimately mitigated during regular version updates.

ðŸ”— https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/01/19/etr-critical-cves-in-outdated-versions-of-atlassian-confluence-and-vmware-vcenter-server/

#Atlassian #Confluence #RCE #vulnerability #activeexploitation #eitw #CVE202334048 #CVE202322527

##
simontsui at 2024-01-16T13:06:11.923Z ##

ðŸ”— https://confluence.atlassian.com/security/security-bulletin-january-16-2024-1333335615.html

jbhall56 at 2024-01-23T12:30:25.292Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2023-22527 (CVSS score: 10.0), the vulnerability impacts out-of-date versions of the software, allowing unauthenticated attackers to achieve remote code execution on susceptible installations. https://thehackernews.com/2024/01/40000-attacks-in-3-days-critical.html

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-01-23T00:18:51.000Z ##

Threat actors are exploiting a recently patched Atlassian Confluence vulnerability. Tracked as CVE-2023-22527, the vulnerability has a severity rating of 10/10 and allows for unauthenticated remote code execution attacks.

Attacks began on January 19, three days after Atlassian released a patch.

https://mastodon.social/@shadowserver@infosec.exchange/111799051613677052

After the attacks got underway, a technical write-up and proof-of-concept code was also published on a Chinese tech blog. https://www.ctfiot.com/158511.html

##

CVE-2024-21887
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.42%

28 posts

A command injection vulnerability in web components of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows an authenticated administrator to send specially crafted requests and execute arbitrary commands on the appliance.

10 repos

https://github.com/TheRedDevil1/Check-Vulns-Script

https://github.com/oways/ivanti-CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/tucommenceapousser/CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/duy-31/CVE-2023-46805_CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/raminkarimkhani1996/CVE-2023-46805_CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/seajaysec/Ivanti-Connect-Around-Scan

https://github.com/yoryio/CVE-2023-46805

https://github.com/mickdec/CVE-2023-46805_CVE-2024-21887_scan_grouped

https://github.com/rxwx/pulse-meter

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-01-21T00:58:04.000Z ##

Security researchers from Assetnote have found new ways to exploit the recent Ivanti zero-days (CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887) on older versions of the Connect Secure firmware.

https://www.assetnote.io/resources/research/high-signal-detection-and-exploitation-of-ivantis-pulse-connect-secure-auth-bypass-rce

According to GreyNoise, exploitation of these zero-days has extended from a Chinese APT to cryptomining botnets.

https://www.greynoise.io/blog/ivanti-connect-secure-exploited-to-install-cryptominers

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T18:33:09.934Z ##

CISA issues Emergency Directive 24-01: Mitigate Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Vulnerabilities in response to CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high, disclosed by Ivanti on 10 January 2024 as exploited zero-days) authentication bypass in Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Version 9.x and 22.x and CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) command injection in Ivanti Connect Secure VPN Version 9.x and 22.x

ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities

simontsui at 2024-01-16T01:17:49.542Z ##

Volexity reports the following about CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887:

  • Exploitation of these vulnerabilities is now widespread. Volexity has been able to find evidence of compromise of over 1,700 devices worldwide.
  • Additional threat actors beyond UTA0178 appear to now have access to the exploit and are actively trying to exploit devices.

15-01-2024 | Volexity divulgue des preuves d'exploitation massive et la compromission prÃ©sumÃ©e d'au moins 1700 dispositifs ICS.

#CyberVeille #Ivanti #CVE_2023_46805

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-16T01:17:49.000Z ##

Volexity reports the following about CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887:

  • Exploitation of these vulnerabilities is now widespread. Volexity has been able to find evidence of compromise of over 1,700 devices worldwide.
  • Additional threat actors beyond UTA0178 appear to now have access to the exploit and are actively trying to exploit devices.

ðŸ”— https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-goes-global/

#Ivanti #zeroday #eitw #vulnerability #CVE202346805 #CVE202421887 #KEV

##

CVE-2023-35078
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.34%

2 posts

Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM), formerly MobileIron Core, through 11.10 allows remote attackers to obtain PII, add an administrative account, and change the configuration because of an authentication bypass, as exploited in the wild in July 2023. A patch is available.

6 repos

https://github.com/lager1/CVE-2023-35078

https://github.com/emanueldosreis/nmap-CVE-2023-35078-Exploit

https://github.com/vchan-in/CVE-2023-35078-Exploit-POC

https://github.com/synfinner/CVE-2023-35078

https://github.com/Blue-number/CVE-2023-35078

https://github.com/raytheon0x21/CVE-2023-35078

simontsui at 2024-01-18T20:07:43.271Z ##

There's currently no public reference suggesting that CVE-2023-35082 was being exploited, so CISA may have received inside information from an affected organization. For more information on how CVE-2023-35082 relates to the previously disclosed Ivanti EPMM zero-days see the following excerpt:
"Since CVE-2023-35082 arises from the same place as CVE-2023-35078, specifically the permissive nature of certain entries in the mifs web applicationâ€™s security filter chain, Rapid7 would consider this new vulnerability a patch bypass for CVE-2023-35078."
Discovered by Rapid7: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/08/02/cve-2023-35082-mobileiron-core-unauthenticated-api-access-vulnerability/

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T20:07:43.000Z ##

There's currently no public reference suggesting that CVE-2023-35082 was being exploited, so CISA may have received inside information from an affected organization. For more information on how CVE-2023-35082 relates to the previously disclosed Ivanti EPMM zero-days see the following excerpt:
"Since CVE-2023-35082 arises from the same place as CVE-2023-35078, specifically the permissive nature of certain entries in the mifs web applicationâ€™s security filter chain, Rapid7 would consider this new vulnerability a patch bypass for CVE-2023-35078."
Discovered by Rapid7: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/08/02/cve-2023-35082-mobileiron-core-unauthenticated-api-access-vulnerability/

##

CVE-2023-35082
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 93.27%

8 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability in Ivanti EPMM 11.10 and older, allows unauthorized users to access restricted functionality or resources of the application without proper authentication. This vulnerability is unique to CVE-2023-35078 announced earlier.

1 repos

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2023-35082

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-20T11:55:02.000Z ##

U.S. CISA warns of actively exploited Ivanti EPMM flaw CVE-2023-35082 â€“ Source: securityaffairs.com https://ciso2ciso.com/u-s-cisa-warns-of-actively-exploited-ivanti-epmm-flaw-cve-2023-35082-source-securityaffairs-com/ #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #rssfeedpostgeneratorecho #informationsecuritynews #ITInformationSecurity #SecurityAffairscom #CyberSecurityNews #PierluigiPaganini #SecurityAffairs #SecurityAffairs #BreakingNews #SecurityNews #hackingnews #IvantiEPMM #Security #hacking #CISA

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-19T18:35:03.000Z ##

Ivanti EPMM and MobileIron Core vulnerability is actively exploited, CISA confirms (CVE-2023-35082) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/01/19/exploited-cve-2023-35082/ #endpointmanagement #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #GreyNoise #exploit #Ivanti #Rapid7 #News #CISA

##
zeljkazorz at 2024-01-19T16:36:34.326Z ##

@simontsui

Ivanti's Knowledge Base article for CVE-2023-35082 (https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-Remote-Unauthenticated-API-Access-Vulnerability-CVE-2023-35082?language=en_US) - ostensibly last updated on August 22, 2023 - states in the FAQ section that "Ivanti has been informed of exploitation by a few customers who have been exploited since the details were made publicly available by Rapid7."

Why hasn't CISA added CVE-2023-35082 to the KEV catalog in August 2023?

I don't know all the ways how CISA gets information about a specific vulnerability being actively exploited. Are (US-based) software companies required to share exploitation info with CISA? Does CISA rely on security advisories (and checking back for updates) for it? Do they rely on compromised organizations flagging vuln exploitation? (I have asked them and will hopefully get some answers.)

##
simontsui at 2024-01-18T20:07:43.271Z ##

"Since CVE-2023-35082 arises from the same place as CVE-2023-35078, specifically the permissive nature of certain entries in the mifs web applicationâ€™s security filter chain, Rapid7 would consider this new vulnerability a patch bypass for CVE-2023-35078."
Discovered by Rapid7: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/08/02/cve-2023-35082-mobileiron-core-unauthenticated-api-access-vulnerability/

##

CVE-2023-46805
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 93.05%

30 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability in the web component of Ivanti ICS 9.x, 22.x and Ivanti Policy Secure allows a remote attacker to access restricted resources by bypassing control checks.

campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-01-21T00:58:04.000Z ##

Security researchers from Assetnote have found new ways to exploit the recent Ivanti zero-days (CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887) on older versions of the Connect Secure firmware.

https://www.assetnote.io/resources/research/high-signal-detection-and-exploitation-of-ivantis-pulse-connect-secure-auth-bypass-rce

According to GreyNoise, exploitation of these zero-days has extended from a Chinese APT to cryptomining botnets.

https://www.greynoise.io/blog/ivanti-connect-secure-exploited-to-install-cryptominers

(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 62.42%

4 posts

In Laravel Framework through 5.5.40 and 5.6.x through 5.6.29, remote code execution might occur as a result of an unserialize call on a potentially untrusted X-XSRF-TOKEN value. This involves the decrypt method in `Illuminate/Encryption/Encrypter.php` and PendingBroadcast in `gadgetchains/Laravel/RCE/3/chain.php` in phpggc. ##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-17T16:22:46.000Z ##

We have the first vendor product actually vulnerable to that Apache Struts vuln from December 2023 - CVE-2023-50164.

Product: Trackplus Allegra
Tailored POC: https://srcincite.io/pocs/src-2024-0001.py.txt
Advisory: https://srcincite.io/advisories/src-2024-0001/

Complete with ../.. directory traversal too.

Disclosure Timeline:

2023-11-08 â€“ Vulnerability reported to security@struts.apache.org

2023-12-21 â€“ Silently patched by the vendor

##
simontsui at 2024-01-17T12:57:57.262Z ##

Oracle confirms that the Apache Struts 2 RCE vulnerability CVE-2023-50164 affects three products and provided patches against these vulnerable versions:

  • Oracle Communications Policy Management 12.6.1.0.0, 15.0.0.0.0
  • Oracle Hyperion Infrastructure Technology 11.2.14.0.000
  • Oracle MySQL Enterprise Monitor 8.0.36 and prior

ðŸ”— https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2024.html

CVE-2022-41328
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 5.86%

2 posts

A improper limitation of a pathname to a restricted directory vulnerability ('path traversal') [CWE-22] in Fortinet FortiOS version 7.2.0 through 7.2.3, 7.0.0 through 7.0.9 and before 6.4.11 allows a privileged attacker to read and write files on the underlying Linux system via crafted CLI commands.

simontsui at 2024-01-19T17:33:52.738Z ##

UNC3886 is a Chinese state-sponsored cyberespionage group that has targeted and exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in firewall and virtualization technologies, which do not support EDR solutions. UNC3886 has primarily targeted defense, technology, and telecommunication organizations located in the US and APJ regions. First public reporting on UNC3886 exploitation came from Mandiant on 29 September 2022.

UNC886 has been known to leverage the following vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2022-41328 (7.1 high, disclosed 07 March 2023, in KEV) Fortinet FortiOS local directory traversal leads to arbitrary read/write
  • CVE-2023-20867 (3.9 low, disclosed 13 June 2023 by VMware, in KEV, VMware Tools Authentication Bypass)
  • CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to RCE)

#UNC3886 #CVE202241328 #CVE202320867 #CVE202334048 #VMware #vCenter #RCE #FortiOS #KEV #China #cyberespionage #VMwaretools #APT

##

UNC3886 is a Chinese state-sponsored cyberespionage group that has targeted and exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in firewall and virtualization technologies, which do not support EDR solutions. UNC3886 has primarily targeted defense, technology, and telecommunication organizations located in the US and APJ regions. First public reporting on UNC3886 exploitation came from Mandiant on 29 September 2022.

UNC886 has been known to leverage the following vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2022-41328 (7.1 high, disclosed 07 March 2023, in KEV) Fortinet FortiOS local directory traversal leads to arbitrary read/write
  • CVE-2023-20867 (3.9 low, disclosed 13 June 2023 by VMware, in KEV, VMware Tools Authentication Bypass)
  • CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to RCE)

##
fredbrooker@witter.cz at 2024-01-25T18:09:52.000Z ##

Over 5,300 internet-exposed GitLab instances are vulnerable to CVE-2023-7028, a zero-click account takeover flaw GitLab warned about earlier this month.

The critical (CVSS score: 10.0) flaw allows attackers to send password reset emails for a targeted account to an attacker-controlled email address, allowing the threat actor to change the password and take over the account.

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/over-5-300-gitlab-servers-exposed-to-zero-click-account-takeover-attacks/

##
snafu@digitalcourage.social at 2024-01-15T22:40:45.000Z ##

So, in case anyone still thinks that patching and security in general is not so important nowadays: Found already several tries of exploiting the recent critical CVE-2023-7028 vulnerability in the logs of my GitLab instance although it was only published a few days ago.

Conclusion:
âœ… Install security updates *literally* ASAP.
âœ… Turn on mandatory 2FA for all users.

#GitLab #CVE #2FA #Security #Hacker #Update

##
snafu@digitalcourage.social at 2024-01-15T22:40:45.000Z ##

So, in case anyone still thinks that patching and security in general is not so important nowadays: Found already several tries of exploiting the recent critical CVE-2023-7028 vulnerability in the logs of my GitLab instance although it was only published a few days ago.

Conclusion:
âœ… Install security updates *literally* ASAP.
âœ… Turn on mandatory 2FA for all users.

#GitLab #CVE #2FA #Security #Hacker #Update

##

CVE-2018-10088
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 2.61%

2 posts

Buffer overflow in XiongMai uc-httpd 1.0.0 has unspecified impact and attack vectors, a different vulnerability than CVE-2017-16725.

simontsui at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.426Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesnâ€™t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

ðŸ”— https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

#7777Botnet #botnet #TPLink #Xiongmai #Hikvision #CVE202177577 #CVE201810088 #CVE202245460 #CVE202136260 #CVE202224355 #MVPower #Zyxel #GitLab

  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesnâ€™t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

##

CVE-2023-34048
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.72%

19 posts

vCenter Server contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol.Â A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger an out-of-bounds write potentially leading to remote code execution.

ChrisShort@hachyderm.io at 2024-01-22T16:17:01.000Z ##

Suggested Read: vCenter Server vulnerability exploited for two years https://www.thestack.technology/vcenter-server-vulnerability-cve-2023-34048/?ref=the-stack-newsletter #devopsish

##
simontsui at 2024-01-22T15:45:50.388Z ##

@Walker CVE-2023-34048 was added to CISA's KEV Catalog today 22 January 2024. This is based on Mandiant's assessment that the Chinese state-sponsored threat actor UNC3886 exploited this vulnerability as a zero-day since at least late 2021.

##
simontsui at 2024-01-22T15:13:57.111Z ##

CISA adds CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 October 2023 by VMware, reported by Mandiant as exploited as a zero-day since 2021) VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog.
ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/22/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

#CVE202334048 #VMware #CISA #KEV #eitw #activeexploitation #Mandiant #UNC3886 #cyberespionage #vCenter #zeroday #vulnerability #cybersecurity

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-01-20T06:30:03.000Z ##

China-linked APT UNC3886 Exploits VMware Zero-Day Since 2021 https://securityaffairs.com/157769/apt/unc3886-exploits-vcenter-server-zero-day-cve-2023-34048.html?&web_view=true #ThreatActors

##
dangoodin at 2024-01-19T22:38:40.067Z ##

Current or former zerodays currently under mass exploitation:

-- Ivanti Policy Secure and Ivanti Connect Secure (CVE-2023-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887)

-- VMware Vcenter Server (CVE-2023-34048 )

Are there any major others I'm forgetting?

@GossiTheDog

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T17:33:52.738Z ##

UNC3886 is a Chinese state-sponsored cyberespionage group that has targeted and exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in firewall and virtualization technologies, which do not support EDR solutions. UNC3886 has primarily targeted defense, technology, and telecommunication organizations located in the US and APJ regions. First public reporting on UNC3886 exploitation came from Mandiant on 29 September 2022.

UNC886 has been known to leverage the following vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2022-41328 (7.1 high, disclosed 07 March 2023, in KEV) Fortinet FortiOS local directory traversal leads to arbitrary read/write
  • CVE-2023-20867 (3.9 low, disclosed 13 June 2023 by VMware, in KEV, VMware Tools Authentication Bypass)
  • CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to RCE)

#UNC3886 #CVE202241328 #CVE202320867 #CVE202334048 #VMware #vCenter #RCE #FortiOS #KEV #China #cyberespionage #VMwaretools #APT

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-01-19T16:50:38.000Z ##

Chinese hackers exploit VMware bug as zero-day for two years

A Chinese hacking group has been exploiting a critical vCenter Server vulnerability (CVE-2023-34048) as a zero-day since at least late 2021.

ðŸ”—ï¸ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/o1koof

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T16:37:43.513Z ##

HOT OFF THE PRESS: Mandiant reports that Chinese Espionage Group UNC3886 was found exploiting VMware vCenter RCE vulnerability CVE-2023-34048 as a Zero-Day since late 2021!
ðŸ”— https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/chinese-vmware-exploitation-since-2021

#Mandiant #UNC3886 #VMware #vCenter #CVE202334048 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
simontsui at 2024-01-19T16:01:42.929Z ##

Rapid7 warns of both VMware RCE vulnerability CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation) and Atlassian Confluence RCE vulnerability CVE-2023-22527 (10.0 critical, disclosed 16 January 2024).
ðŸ”— https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/01/19/etr-critical-cves-in-outdated-versions-of-atlassian-confluence-and-vmware-vcenter-server/

simontsui at 2024-01-19T14:29:42.822Z ##

VMware updated their advisory for CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 October 2023, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability, allows RCE) "VMware has confirmed that exploitation of CVE-2023-34048 has occurred in the wild."
ðŸ”— https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2023-0023.html

UNC3886 is a Chinese state-sponsored cyberespionage group that has targeted and exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in firewall and virtualization technologies, which do not support EDR solutions. UNC3886 has primarily targeted defense, technology, and telecommunication organizations located in the US and APJ regions. First public reporting on UNC3886 exploitation came from Mandiant on 29 September 2022.

UNC886 has been known to leverage the following vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2022-41328 (7.1 high, disclosed 07 March 2023, in KEV) Fortinet FortiOS local directory traversal leads to arbitrary read/write
  • CVE-2023-20867 (3.9 low, disclosed 13 June 2023 by VMware, in KEV, VMware Tools Authentication Bypass)
  • CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to RCE)

(5.3 MEDIUM)

2 posts

A Missing Authentication for Critical Function vulnerability in Juniper Networks Junos OS on SRX Series allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to cause limited impact to the file system integrity. With a specific request that doesn't require authentication an attacker is able to upload arbitrary files via J-Web, leading to a loss of integrity for a certainÂ  part of theÂ file syste

CVE-2023-6548
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 1.07%

10 posts

[PROBLEMTYPE] in [COMPONENT] in [VENDOR] [PRODUCT] [VERSION] on [PLATFORMS] allows [ATTACKER] to [IMPACT] via [VECTOR]

simontsui at 2024-01-18T17:57:21.303Z ##

CISA buries the lede in their cybersecurity alert about Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway, by not mentioning that CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549 are exploited zero-days. See the KEV Catalog announcement that this toot is a reply to.
ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/18/citrix-releases-security-updates-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway
"Exploits of these CVEs on unmitigated appliances have been observed."

#CISA #securityadvisory #CVE20236548 #CVE20236549 #Citrix #NetScaler #ADC #zeroday #activeexploitation #eitw

##
j0hnb3r00t at 2024-01-18T09:43:34.284Z ##

CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549 #citrix

##
simontsui at 2024-01-17T16:49:42.722Z ##

CISA put a 1 week deadline on CVE-2023-6548 whereas CVE-2023-6549 and CVE-2024-0519 have a 3 week deadline. This is likely because CVE- 2023- 6548 only impacts the management interface, and the management interface should NOT be exposed to the internet in the first place.

##
simontsui at 2024-01-17T16:37:11.731Z ##

CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog:

  • CVE-2023-6549 Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6548 Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Code Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-0519 Google Chromium V8 Out-of-Bounds Memory Access Vulnerability

ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/17/cisa-adds-three-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

##
simontsui at 2024-01-16T12:46:52.256Z ##

Citrix security advisory contains two zero-days: Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in NetScaler ADC (formerly Citrix ADC) and NetScaler Gateway (formerly Citrix Gateway):

  • CVE-2023-6548 (5.5 medium) Authenticated (low privileged) remote code execution on Management Interface
  • CVE-2023-6549 (8.2 high) Denial of Service

"Exploits of these CVEs on unmitigated appliances have been observed."
ðŸ”— https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX584986/netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549

j0hnb3r00t@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-18T09:43:34.000Z ##

CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549 #citrix

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-17T16:49:42.000Z ##

CISA put a 1 week deadline on CVE-2023-6548 whereas CVE-2023-6549 and CVE-2024-0519 have a 3 week deadline. This is likely because CVE- 2023- 6548 only impacts the management interface, and the management interface should NOT be exposed to the internet in the first place.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-17T16:37:11.000Z ##

CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog:

  • CVE-2023-6549 Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6548 Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Code Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-0519 Google Chromium V8 Out-of-Bounds Memory Access Vulnerability

ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/17/cisa-adds-three-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

#CISA #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CVE20236548 #CVE20236549 #CVE20240519 #Chrome #Google #Citrix #NetScaler #ADC #activeexploitation #eitw #vulnerability

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-16T12:46:52.000Z ##

Citrix security advisory contains two zero-days: Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in NetScaler ADC (formerly Citrix ADC) and NetScaler Gateway (formerly Citrix Gateway):

  • CVE-2023-6548 (5.5 medium) Authenticated (low privileged) remote code execution on Management Interface
  • CVE-2023-6549 (8.2 high) Denial of Service

"Exploits of these CVEs on unmitigated appliances have been observed."
ðŸ”— https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX584986/netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549

#CVE20236548 #CVE20236549 #Citrix #vulnerability #securityadvisory #Netscaler #PatchTuesday

##

CVE-2023-6549
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.72%

10 posts

Denial of Service

simontsui at 2024-01-18T17:57:21.303Z ##

CISA buries the lede in their cybersecurity alert about Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway, by not mentioning that CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549 are exploited zero-days. See the KEV Catalog announcement that this toot is a reply to.
ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/18/citrix-releases-security-updates-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway
"Exploits of these CVEs on unmitigated appliances have been observed."

avoidthehack at 2024-01-17T19:06:17.059Z ##

Hackers Weaponize #Windows Flaw to Deploy Crypto-Siphoning Phemedrone Stealer

Note: This vulnerability (CVE-2023-36025) is now patched as of NOV 2023. So hopefully you've updated your Windows device(s) since November 2023 Patch Tuesday.

Also, this campaign is yet another that abuses Discord's CDN by hosting the malware. The #malware executes a control panel file in a way that bypasses #Defender SmartScreen. Paves the way for loading information stealer "Phemedrone"

CVE-2017-7577
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.50%

2 posts

XiongMai uc-httpd has directory traversal allowing the reading of arbitrary files via a "GET ../" HTTP request.

simontsui at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.426Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesnâ€™t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

ðŸ”— https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.

Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited..

2 posts

A memory corruption vulnerability exists in Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect portal and gateway interfaces that enables an unauthenticated network-based attacker to disrupt system processes and potentially execute arbitrary code with root privileges. (9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.21%

2 posts

Multiple Xiongmai NVR devices, including MBD6304T V4.02.R11.00000117.10001.131900.00000 and NBD6808T-PL V4.02.R11.C7431119.12001.130000.00000, allow an unauthenticated and remote user to exploit a stack-based buffer overflow and crash the web server, resulting in a system reboot. An unauthenticated and remote attacker can execute arbitrary code by sending a crafted HTTP request that triggers the o

simontsui at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.426Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesnâ€™t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

12 posts

hnbot@chrispelli.fun at 2024-01-24T16:26:00.000Z ##

#hackernews

##
simontsui at 2024-01-17T19:08:31.280Z ##

Microsoft MSRC published three security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-0517Chromium: CVE-2024-0517 Out of bounds write in V8
  • CVE-2024-0518 Chromium: CVE-2024-0518 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-0519 Chromium: CVE-2024-0519 Out of bounds memory access in V8

Note: "Google is aware of reports that an exploit for CVE-2024-0519 exists in the wild." Google marked these vulnerabilities as high severity.

#Microsoft #MSRC #Google #Chrome #activeexploitation #CVE20240519 #zeroday

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-17T16:37:11.000Z ##

CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog:

  • CVE-2023-6549 Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6548 Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Code Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-0519 Google Chromium V8 Out-of-Bounds Memory Access Vulnerability

ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/17/cisa-adds-three-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

#CISA #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CVE20236548 #CVE20236549 #CVE20240519 #Chrome #Google #Citrix #NetScaler #ADC #activeexploitation #eitw #vulnerability

avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-17T15:54:28.000Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-0519. Out-of-bounds read in the V8 JavaScript engine. Likely affects all Chromium browsers so be sure to update.

##

CVE-2023-20867
(3.9 LOW)

EPSS: 0.16%

2 posts

A fully compromised ESXi host can force VMware Tools to fail to authenticate host-to-guest operations, impacting the confidentiality and integrity of the guest virtual machine.

simontsui at 2024-01-19T17:33:52.738Z ##

UNC3886 is a Chinese state-sponsored cyberespionage group that has targeted and exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in firewall and virtualization technologies, which do not support EDR solutions. UNC3886 has primarily targeted defense, technology, and telecommunication organizations located in the US and APJ regions. First public reporting on UNC3886 exploitation came from Mandiant on 29 September 2022.

UNC886 has been known to leverage the following vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2022-41328 (7.1 high, disclosed 07 March 2023, in KEV) Fortinet FortiOS local directory traversal leads to arbitrary read/write
  • CVE-2023-20867 (3.9 low, disclosed 13 June 2023 by VMware, in KEV, VMware Tools Authentication Bypass)
  • CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to RCE)

#UNC3886 #CVE202241328 #CVE202320867 #CVE202334048 #VMware #vCenter #RCE #FortiOS #KEV #China #cyberespionage #VMwaretools #APT

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-19T17:33:52.000Z ##

UNC3886 is a Chinese state-sponsored cyberespionage group that has targeted and exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in firewall and virtualization technologies, which do not support EDR solutions. UNC3886 has primarily targeted defense, technology, and telecommunication organizations located in the US and APJ regions. First public reporting on UNC3886 exploitation came from Mandiant on 29 September 2022.

UNC886 has been known to leverage the following vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2022-41328 (7.1 high, disclosed 07 March 2023, in KEV) Fortinet FortiOS local directory traversal leads to arbitrary read/write
  • CVE-2023-20867 (3.9 low, disclosed 13 June 2023 by VMware, in KEV, VMware Tools Authentication Bypass)
  • CVE-2023-34048 (9.8 critical, disclosed 25 Octover 2023, under active exploitation, VMware vCenter Server Out-of-Bounds Write Vulnerability to RCE)

CVE-2023-42917
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.14%

2 posts

A memory corruption vulnerability was addressed with improved locking. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.1.2 and iPadOS 17.1.2, macOS Sonoma 14.1.2, Safari 17.1.2. Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited against versions of iOS before iOS 16.7.1.

simontsui at 2024-01-22T19:10:40.967Z ##

Google TAG has historically reported on zero-days developed and exploited by surveillance/spyware vendors.

##

CVE-2024-23222
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.13%

20 posts

A type confusion issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.3, iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3, macOS Sonoma 14.3, iOS 16.7.5 and iPadOS 16.7.5, Safari 17.3, macOS Ventura 13.6.4, macOS Monterey 12.7.3. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited.

simontsui at 2024-01-23T16:01:24.848Z ##

CISA adds CVE-2024-23222 to the KEV Catalog. Disclosed on 22 January 2024 by Apple, this exploited zero-day affects WebKit, and was patched in tvOS 17.3, iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3, macOS Sonoma 14.3, iOS 16.7.5 and iPadOS 16.7.5, Safari 17.3, macOS Ventura 13.6.4, macOS Monterey 12.7.3.
ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/23/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

#Apple #zeroday #vulnerability #activeexploitation #eitw #CVE202423222 #CISA #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-01-23T08:43:25.268Z ##

"ðŸš¨ Critical Zero-Day Patch Released by Apple - CVE-2024-23222 ðŸš¨"

Apple has urgently released updates for a range of its devices, including iPhones, Macs, and Apple TVs, to patch a critical zero-day flaw (CVE-2024-23222). This type confusion vulnerability, which can lead to arbitrary code execution when processing specially crafted web content, has been reportedly exploited in the wild. The patch addresses this issue with enhanced checks.

This zero-day bug is the first Apple has fixed in 2024, following their action on 20 zero-days last year. Updates are available for iOS 17.3 & iPadOS 17.3 (iPhone XS and later, various iPad models), macOS Sonoma 14.3, macOS Ventura 13.6.4, macOS Monterey 12.7.3, tvOS 17.3, and Safari 17.3.

Tags: #AppleSecurity #ZeroDay #CVE202423222 #CyberSecurity #PatchNow #TypeConfusion #CodeExecution #UpdateAlert ðŸðŸ’»ðŸ”’

Mitre CVE-2024-23222

Source: TheHackerNews

##
simontsui at 2024-01-22T23:17:06.208Z ##

Apple released a late security advisory for Safari 17.3, which is also affected by the newly identified and exploited zero-day CVE-2024-23222.
ðŸ”— https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT214056

#Apple #zeroday #vulnerability #activeexploitation #eitw #CVE202423222 #Safari

##
simontsui at 2024-01-22T18:50:28.962Z ##

Hot off the press: Apple zero day: CVE-2024-23222 affects Webkit: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited.

  • https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT214055
  • https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT214057

A Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to cause Denial of Service (DoS), which could cause an impacted firewall to crash.

CVE-2021-23015(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.10%

2 posts

On BIG-IP 15.1.x before 15.1.3, 14.1.x before 14.1.4.2, 13.1.0.8 through 13.1.3.6, and all versions of 16.0.x, when running in Appliance Mode, an authenticated user assigned the 'Administrator' role may be able to bypass Appliance Mode restrictions utilizing undisclosed iControl REST endpoints. Note: Software versions which have reached End of Technical Support (EoTS) are not evaluated.

simontsui at 2024-01-22T15:41:06.045Z ##

Ron Bowes @iagox86 of @greynoise blogs about the Confusing History of F5 BIG-IP RCE Vulnerabilities, stemming from a unidentified shell-injection attack against the filePath parameter in the F5 BIG-IP login page. This turned out to be CVE-2021-23015, but the path to figuring that out is an interesting read.

CVE-2022-44729
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.10%

1 posts

Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in Apache Software Foundation Apache XML Graphics Batik.This issue affects Apache XML Graphics Batik: 1.16. On version 1.16, a malicious SVG could trigger loading external resources by default, causing resource consumption or in some cases even information disclosure. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.17 or later.

h4sh at 2024-01-18T11:57:52.149Z ##

@simontsui yea CVE-2024-20272 should be a 9.8 - unauthenticated RCE leading to root access is always at least that (if not 10.0)

Vendor CNAs are not mandated to do the right thing, there is no contract between MITRE and partner CNAs to tell them what to do, and some companies (like Apple) don't even publish CVSS

#cisco #cve

simontsui at 2024-01-18T15:13:57.426Z ##

VulnCheck wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  • 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesnâ€™t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

ðŸ”— https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet

  • The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  • The botnet doesnâ€™t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

CVE-2023-46446
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

1 posts

### Summary An issue in AsyncSSH v2.14.0 and earlier allows attackers to control the remote end of an SSH client session via packet injection/removal and shell emulation. ### Details The rogue session attack targets any SSH client connecting to an AsyncSSH server, on which the attacker must have a shell account. The goal of the attack is to log the client into the attacker's account without the

communityblog.fedoraproject.org@communityblog.fedoraproject.org at 2024-01-26T10:14:21.000Z ##

This is a weekly report from the I&R (Infrastructure & Release Engineering) Team. It also contain updates for CPE (Community Platform Engineering) Team as the CPE initiatives are in most cases tied to I&R work.

We provide you both infographic and text version of the weekly report. If you just want to quickly look at what we did, just look at the infographic. If you are interested in more in depth details look below the infographic.

Week: 22 Jan â€“ 26 Jan 2024

[ðŸ–¼ I&R infographic]

[ðŸ–¼ I&R infographic] [ðŸ–¼ I&R infographic]

Infrastructure & Release Engineering

Purpose of this team is to take care of day to day business regarding CentOS and Fedora Infrastructure and Fedora release engineering work.
Itâ€™s responsible for services running in Fedora and CentOS infrastructure and preparing things for the new Fedora release (mirrors, mass branching, new namespaces etc.).
List of planned/in-progress issues

Fedora Infra

  • Dealing with IPA/authentication outage â€“ it seems to be mostly fixed
  • Move IRC nagios alerts to Matrix
  • Deploy rpmautospec version 0.3.8+ to koji
  • proxies: adjust logrotate to xz logs
  • Enable Auto-Signing for f40-rebuild Mass-Rebuild Tag

CentOS Infra including CentOS CI

  • Update pungi on CS Koji to match Brewâ€™s version

Release Engineering

  • F40 schedule postponed by one week, due to issues during mass rebuild
  • F40 mass rebuild currently ongoing
  • Use DNF 5 as package manager for Mock
  • Create EPEL 10 package signing key

CPE Initiatives

EPEL

Extra Packages for Enterprise Linux (or EPEL) is a Fedora Special Interest Group that creates, maintains, and manages a high quality set of additional packages for Enterprise Linux, including, but not limited to, Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL), CentOS and Scientific Linux (SL), Oracle Linux (OL).

Updates

  • Backport fix for CVE-2023-46445 and CVE-2023-46446 to python-asyncssh in EPEL 9

Matrix Native Zodbot

With ongoing stability issues with the Matrix <-> IRC bridge and many contributors switching over to Matrix, zodbot has become increasingly unreliable. The bridge is currently shut off completely. This initiative will provide a future proof solution and allow us to conduct meetings without wasting time troubleshooting the bridge and zodbot.

Updates

  • Nonbot now is notifying on pagure repos (new issues and git pushes). This was done previously with a generic maubot webhook plugin, but now uses a pagure-specific plugin. This has the benefit of being able to notify any room about any pagure repo. Additionally, the old generic way was not checking if messages were coming from pagure, now it verifies against the pagure webhook key.

If you have any questions or feedback, please respond to this report or contact us on #redhat-cpe channel on matrix.

https://communityblog.fedoraproject.org/infra-releng-update-week-4-2024/

#InfraReleng #redhat

(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

2 posts

Type confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 120.0.6099.224 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

simontsui at 2024-01-17T19:08:31.280Z ##

Microsoft MSRC published three security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-0517Chromium: CVE-2024-0517 Out of bounds write in V8
  • CVE-2024-0518 Chromium: CVE-2024-0518 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-0519 Chromium: CVE-2024-0519 Out of bounds memory access in V8

Note: "Google is aware of reports that an exploit for CVE-2024-0519 exists in the wild." Google marked these vulnerabilities as high severity.

##

CVE-2024-23525
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

2 posts

The Spreadsheet::ParseXLSX package before 0.30 for Perl allows XXE attacks because it neglects to use the no_xxe option of XML::Twig.

nuddlegg@fosstodon.org at 2024-01-18T12:13:20.000Z ##

CVE-2024-23525 has been fixed in latest release of Spreadsheet::ParseXLSX

https://metacpan.org/dist/Spreadsheet-ParseXLSX

#perl #cve #security #xxe

##

CVE-2022-44037
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

2 posts

An access control issue in APsystems ENERGY COMMUNICATION UNIT (ECU-C) Power Control Software V4.1NA, V3.11.4, W2.1NA, V4.1SAA, C1.2.2 allows attackers to access sensitive data and execute specific commands and functions with full admin rights without authenticating allows him to perform multiple attacks, such as attacking wireless network in the product's range.

simontsui at 2024-01-23T18:12:27.303Z ##

CISA Releases Six Industrial Control Systems Advisories. Interesting notes:

  • APSystems has not responded to requests to work with CISA to mitigate this vulnerability, ergo CVE-2022-44037 (8.8 high) is unpatched.
    • CISA discovered public proof of concept as authored by Momen Eldawakhly (Cyber Guy)
  • Voltronic Power did not respond to CISA's attempts at coordination. Four vulnerabilities are unpatched, including RCE and even unauthenticated administrative password change.
  • Lantronix states that XPort is an old legacy product and is not designed for strong encryption or TLS/SSL encryption. That means they won't fix it.

ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/23/cisa-releases-six-industrial-control-systems-advisories

#CISA #ICS #SecurityAdvisory #vulnerability

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-23T18:12:27.000Z ##

CISA Releases Six Industrial Control Systems Advisories. Interesting notes:

  • APSystems has not responded to requests to work with CISA to mitigate this vulnerability, ergo CVE-2022-44037 (8.8 high) is unpatched.
    • CISA discovered public proof of concept as authored by Momen Eldawakhly (Cyber Guy)
  • Voltronic Power did not respond to CISA's attempts at coordination. Four vulnerabilities are unpatched, including RCE and even unauthenticated administrative password change.
  • Lantronix states that XPort is an old legacy product and is not designed for strong encryption or TLS/SSL encryption. That means they won't fix it.

ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/23/cisa-releases-six-industrial-control-systems-advisories

EPSS: 0.06%

2 posts

Issue summary: The POLY1305 MAC (message authentication code) implementation contains a bug that might corrupt the internal state of applications running on PowerPC CPU based platforms if the CPU provides vector instructions. Impact summary: If an attacker can influence whether the POLY1305 MAC algorithm is used, the application state might be corrupted with various application dependent conseque

- CVE-2023-6237
- CVE-2024-0727

##

CVE-2023-43622
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

4 posts

An attacker, opening a HTTP/2 connection with an initial window size of 0, was able to block handling of that connection indefinitely in Apache HTTP Server. This could be used to exhaust worker resources in the server, similar to the well known "slow loris" attack pattern. This has been fixed in version 2.4.58, so that such connection are terminated properly after the configured connection timeout

dashdsrdash@tilde.zone at 2024-01-23T16:11:16.000Z ##

@sbug

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2023-43622

Looks like it will happen in the near future for Debian; in the meantime, if you are concerned, you could turn off HTTPS/2 or rebuild the sid package yourself.

##
sbug@sinnesro.se at 2024-01-23T16:03:39.000Z ##

@dashdsrdash

CVE-2023-43622

It came to my knowledge because we had an external part to a pen test against our company.

##
dashdsrdash@tilde.zone at 2024-01-23T16:11:16.000Z ##

@sbug

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2023-43622

Looks like it will happen in the near future for Debian; in the meantime, if you are concerned, you could turn off HTTPS/2 or rebuild the sid package yourself.

##

CVE-2024-0204
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.06%

49 posts

Authentication bypass in Fortra's GoAnywhere MFT prior to 7.4.1 allows an unauthorized user to create an admin user via the administration portal.

3 repos

https://github.com/horizon3ai/CVE-2024-0204

https://github.com/m-cetin/CVE-2024-0204

https://github.com/cbeek-r7/CVE-2024-0204

hdm at 2024-01-24T01:21:06.727Z ##

The world got weird. Help Systems acquired many security vendors, then spun them out as Fortra, including Cobalt Strike, Core Impact, and this week's flavor of exploitable file transfer software: GoAnywhere MFT (CVE-2024-0204)!

Surely these all belong together.

Looking for exposed GoAnywhere systems? Look for HTML bodies containing: "GoAnywhere Web Client". @runZeroInc search query at: https://www.runzero.com/blog/finding-fortra-goanywhere-mft/

#forta #CVE_2024_0204

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-01-24T00:48:29.042Z ##

And there's the PoC for the #CVE_2024_0204 GoAnyWhere vuln: github.com/horizon3ai/CVE-2024-0204

##
da_667 at 2024-01-23T22:21:37.724Z ##

GoAnywhere MFT #CVE_2024_0204 is... path traversal.

[bullshitpath]/..;/wizard/InitialAccountSetup.xhtml re-runs the initial setup wizard, and lets attackers create their own admin account.

https://www.horizon3.ai/cve-2024-0204-fortra-goanywhere-mft-authentication-bypass-deep-dive/

##
StaceyHolleran at 2024-01-23T19:14:27.572Z ##

Fortra GoAnywhere MFT customers are going to want to take emergency action on this one. https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/01/23/etr-cve-2024-0204-critical-authentication-bypass-in-fortra-goanywhere-mft/ #CVE_2024_0204

##
catc0n at 2024-01-23T18:55:32.134Z ##

For those who hate reading, there's a critical auth bypass in Fortra GoAnywhere MFT (#CVE_2024_0204), the same secure file transfer product exploited in a large-scale #Cl0p campaign in February 2023. The fallout from #CVE-2023_0669 was significant â€” it's unclear from this initial advisory on the new vuln if it's been exploited or not, but evidently the fixed version has been available since December. The advisory looks to be brand new this week.

9.8 critical (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H)
Discovered "01 December 2023"

Affects: Fortra GoAnywhere MFT 6.x from 6.0.1 and Fortra GoAnywhere MFT 7.x before 7.4.1

Fixed in version 7.4.1 or higher.

No mention* of exploitation.

EPSS: 0.05%

2 posts

The ColorMag theme for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access due to a missing capability check on the plugin_action_callback() function in all versions up to, and including, 3.1.2. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to install and activate arbitrary plugins.

CVE-2023-45234
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

2 posts

EDK2's Network Package is susceptible to a buffer overflow vulnerability when processing DNS Servers option from a DHCPv6 Advertise message. This vulnerability can be exploited by an attacker to gain unauthorized access and potentially lead to a loss of Confidentiality, Integrity and/or Availability.

4Dgifts@mastodon.social at 2024-01-16T18:35:02.000Z ##

@mttaggart CVE-2023-45230, CVE-2023-45234 and CVE-2023-45235 are buffer overflows. The first one is straight forward. We have not provided exploits, just ways of reproducing the vulns. Writing a exploit would be doing it tailored to the specific targets but note UEFI firmware does not have any exploit mitigations. Depending what you consider "successful exploitation" YMMV.

##
4Dgifts@mastodon.social at 2024-01-16T18:35:02.000Z ##

@mttaggart CVE-2023-45230, CVE-2023-45234 and CVE-2023-45235 are buffer overflows. The first one is straight forward. We have not provided exploits, just ways of reproducing the vulns. Writing a exploit would be doing it tailored to the specific targets but note UEFI firmware does not have any exploit mitigations. Depending what you consider "successful exploitation" YMMV.

CVE-2024-20666
(6.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

3 posts

BitLocker Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-01-15T19:50:06.000Z ##

Microsoft working on a fix for Windows 10 0x80070643 errors

Microsoft is working to fix a known issue causing 0x80070643 errors when installing the KB5034441 security update that patches the CVE-2024-20666...

ðŸ”—ï¸ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/h041q1

##
Sentry23 at 2024-01-15T09:26:59.329Z ##

So, #microsoft #patches KB5034122 and KB5034123 (Bitlocker encryption vuln CVE-2024-20666) are crapping out on what seems random systems due to an issue with a too small recovery partition.

The solution so far 'resize the recovery partition' is not a solution at schale.

Look, I know writing patches is not easy, but if you are Microsoft, there is no excuse for this.

#edit: on further reading: just another reason to always enable PIN when you deploy bitlocker:

If TPM+PIN BitLocker
protectors are being used, can the vulnerability be exploited if the attacker does not know the TPM PIN?

No. To exploit the vulnerability the attacker needs to know the TPM PIN if the user is protected by the BitLocker TPM+PIN.

##
Sentry23@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-15T09:26:59.000Z ##

So, #microsoft #patches KB5034122 and KB5034123 (Bitlocker encryption vuln CVE-2024-20666) are crapping out on what seems random systems due to an issue with a too small recovery partition.

The solution so far 'resize the recovery partition' is not a solution at schale.

Look, I know writing patches is not easy, but if you are Microsoft, there is no excuse for this.

#edit: on further reading: just another reason to always enable PIN when you deploy bitlocker:

If TPM+PIN BitLocker
protectors are being used, can the vulnerability be exploited if the attacker does not know the TPM PIN?

No. To exploit the vulnerability the attacker needs to know the TPM PIN if the user is protected by the BitLocker TPM+PIN.

CVE-2024-23678
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise for Windows versions below 9.0.8 and 9.1.3, Splunk Enterprise does not correctly sanitize path input data. This results in the unsafe deserialization of untrusted data from a separate disk partition on the machine. This vulnerability only affects Splunk Enterprise for Windows.

##

CVE-2023-6546
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

A race condition was found in the GSM 0710 tty multiplexor in the Linux kernel. This issue occurs when two threads execute the GSMIOC_SETCONF ioctl on the same tty file descriptor with the gsm line discipline enabled, and can lead to a use-after-free problem on a struct gsm_dlci while restarting the gsm mux. This could allow a local unprivileged user to escalate their privileges on the system.

raptor at 2024-01-20T06:58:32.905Z ##

#Linux #Kernel #GSM Multiplexing Race Condition Local Privilege Escalation #Vulnerability (CVE-2023-6546)

https://github.com/Nassim-Asrir/ZDI-24-020

##
raptor@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-20T06:58:32.000Z ##

2 posts

https://jfrog.com/blog/xorg-libx11-vulns-cve-2023-43786-cve-2023-43787-part-one/

Happy to see that other researchers are building upon my previous work

https://security.humanativaspa.it/nothing-new-under-the-sun/

https://github.com/0xdea/advisories/blob/master/HNS-2022-01-dtprintinfo.txt

CVE-2023-46838
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

simontsui at 2024-01-23T14:26:31.984Z ##

Citrix Hypervisor Security Bulletin for CVE-2023-46838. "An issue has been discovered that affects Citrix Hypervisor 8.2 CU1 LTSR and may allow malicious privileged code in a guest VM to cause the host to crash or become unresponsive." We have released a hotfix (NOTE: NOT A PROPER PATCH) to address this issue.
ðŸ”— https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX587605/citrix-hypervisor-security-bulletin-for-cve202346838

CVE-2023-7227
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

SystemK NVR 504/508/516 versions 2.3.5SK.30084998 and prior are vulnerable to a command injection vulnerability in the dynamic domain name system (DDNS) settings that could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges.

simontsui at 2024-01-25T16:44:10.918Z ##

CISA released two industrial control systems advisories. It should be noted that SystemK has not responded to requests to work with CISA to mitigate CVE-2023-7227 (9.8 critical), a command injection vulnerability affecting SystemK NVR 504/508/516 versions 2.3.5SK.30084998 and prior. CISA also discovered a public Proof of Concept (PoC) for it.
ðŸ”— https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/25/cisa-releases-two-industrial-control-systems-advisories

CVE-2024-0402
(9.9 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

1 posts

An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 16.0 prior to 16.6.6, 16.7 prior to 16.7.4, and 16.8 prior to 16.8.1 which allows an authenticated user to write files to arbitrary locations on the GitLab server while creating a workspace.

linuxandyarn at 2024-01-25T18:29:42.880Z ##

#Gitlab just patched a new critical bug allowing users to write to arbitrary file paths. Patch immediately, or based on how much you trust your users not to do fun degenerate things. #CVE_2024_0402

CVE-2024-20305
(4.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Unity Connection could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the interface. This vulnerability exists because the web-based management interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user of the inte

simontsui at 2024-01-24T16:08:38.302Z ##

Cisco security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-20305 (4.3 medium) Cisco Unity Connection Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20263 (5.8 medium) Cisco Small Business Series Switches Stacked Reload ACL Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20253 (9.9 critical) Cisco Unified Communications Products Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

Regarding all three vulnerabilities: The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

CVE-2024-23897(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

22 posts

Jenkins has a built-in command line interface (CLI) to access Jenkins from a script or shell environment. Jenkins uses the args4j library to parse command arguments and options on the Jenkins controller when processing CLI commands. This command parser has a feature that replaces an @ character followed by a file path in an argument with the fileâ€™s contents (expandAtFiles). This feature is enab

simontsui at 2024-01-28T18:36:30.904Z ##

Jenkins RCE CVE-2024-23897 (9.8 critical, proofs of concept publicly available) allegedly being exploited in the wild, reported 3 days ago by a graduate student researcher* of Sky Computing Lab, UC Berkeley.

#Jenkins #RCE #CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #activeexploitation #eitw

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-01-25T14:07:46.265Z ##

Good morning! Have a fairly gnarly RCE in #Jenkins:

Jenkins uses the args4j library to parse command arguments and options on the Jenkins controller when processing CLI commands. This command parser has a feature that replaces an @ character followed by a file path in an argument with the fileâ€™s contents (expandAtFiles). This feature is enabled by default and Jenkins 2.441 and earlier, LTS 2.426.2 and earlier does not disable it.
www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2024-01-24/#SECURITY-3314

#CVE_2024_23897

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-28T18:36:30.000Z ##

SonarResearch at 2024-01-25T13:55:43.753Z ##

ðŸ”Uncovering critical vulnerabilities in Jenkins, which could lead to RCE (CVE-2024-23898, CVE-2024-23897):

Check out our latest blog post for the technical details on how attackers could potentially gain unauthenticated RCE on #Jenkins

https://www.sonarsource.com/blog/excessive-expansion-uncovering-critical-security-vulnerabilities-in-jenkins/?utm_medium=social&utm_source=mastodon&utm_campaign=research&utm_content=blog-excessive-expansion-uncovering-critical-security-vulnerabilities-in-jenkins-240125-p1&utm_term=ww_en_all_x

#appsec #security #vulnerability

##
jbhall56 at 2024-01-25T13:38:19.502Z ##

The issue, assigned the CVE identifier CVE-2024-23897, has been described as an arbitrary file read vulnerability through the built-in command line interface (CLI) https://thehackernews.com/2024/01/critical-jenkins-vulnerability-exposes.html

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-01-25T11:12:21.000Z ##

Jenkins released a patch for a major vulnerability. Tracked as CVE-2024-23897, the vulnerability has a severity rating of 9.8/10 and impacts the app's CLI component.

The Jenkins team has confirmed various attack scenarios that can allow attackers to retrieve cryptographic keys, delete files, or run malicious code through various methods.

If patches can't be installed, the vulnerability can be mitigated by disabling the CLI component.

https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2024-01-24/

##
sans_isc@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-29T02:15:34.000Z ##

Jenkins released a patch for a major vulnerability. Tracked as CVE-2024-23897, the vulnerability has a severity rating of 9.8/10 and impacts the app's CLI component.

The Jenkins team has confirmed various attack scenarios that can allow attackers to retrieve cryptographic keys, delete files, or run malicious code through various methods.

If patches can't be installed, the vulnerability can be mitigated by disabling the CLI component.

##

CVE-2024-21336
(2.5 LOW)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-01-26T18:03:13.315Z ##

CVE-2023-49657
(9.6 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

A stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in Apache Superset before 3.0.3.Â An authenticated attacker with create/update permissions on charts or dashboards could store a script or add a specific HTML snippet that would act as a stored XSS. For 2.X versions, users should change their config to include: TALISMAN_CONFIG = { Â  Â  "content_security_policy": { Â  Â  Â  Â  "base-uri": ["'self

simontsui at 2024-01-25T15:12:00.584Z ##

Apache Superset security advisory: CVE-2023-49657 (9.6 critical) A stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in Apache Superset before 3.0.3. An authenticated attacker with create/update permissions on charts or dashboards could store a script or add a specific HTML snippet that would act as a stored XSS. This was reported by someone at Praetorian, and they will likely publish a vulnerability analysis and Proof of Concept.
ðŸ”— https://lists.apache.org/thread/wjyvz8om9nwd396lh0bt156mtwjxpsvx

#Apache #Superset #vulnerability #CVE_2023_49657 #XSS

CVE-2024-0727(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

Issue summary: Processing a maliciously formatted PKCS12 file may lead OpenSSL to crash leading to a potential Denial of Service attack Impact summary: Applications loading files in the PKCS12 format from untrusted sources might terminate abruptly. A file in PKCS12 format can contain certificates and keys and may come from an untrusted source. The PKCS12 specification allows certain fields to be

##

CVE-2023-40547
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

5 posts

A remote code execution vulnerability was found in Shim. The Shim boot support trusts attacker-controlled values when parsing an HTTP response. This flaw allows an attacker to craft a specific malicious HTTP request, leading to a completely controlled out-of-bounds write primitive and complete system compromise.

harrysintonen at 2024-01-26T20:10:01.044Z ##

Linux shim has a heap buffer overflow #vulnerability CVE-2023-40547 that allows arbitrary code execution and full system compromise when attacker is able to control the HTTP response.

Fixed in commit https://github.com/rhboot/shim/commit/0226b56513b2b8bd5fd281bce77c40c9bf07c66d as part of https://github.com/rhboot/shim/releases/tag/15.8 #cve #infosec

##
newsycombinator@framapiaf.org at 2024-01-25T20:00:54.000Z ##

CVE-2023-40547 â€“ avoid incorrectly trusting HTTP headers
Link: https://github.com/rhboot/shim/commit/0226b56513b2b8bd5fd281bce77c40c9bf07c66d
Comments: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=39132300

##
nixCraft@mastodon.social at 2024-01-25T19:02:03.000Z ##

Ugh. CVE-2023-40547 is a critical bug that exists in every #Linux boot loader signed in the past decade https://github.com/rhboot/shim/commit/0226b56513b2b8bd5fd281bce77c40c9bf07c66d

##
harrysintonen@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-26T20:10:01.000Z ##

Linux shim has a heap buffer overflow #vulnerability CVE-2023-40547 that allows arbitrary code execution and full system compromise when attacker is able to control the HTTP response.

Fixed in commit https://github.com/rhboot/shim/commit/0226b56513b2b8bd5fd281bce77c40c9bf07c66d as part of https://github.com/rhboot/shim/releases/tag/15.8 #cve #infosec

##

CVE-2024-21387
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-01-26T01:10:51.189Z ##

Microsoft MSRC security advisories:

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0804 Insufficient policy enforcement in iOS Security UI
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0805 Inappropriate implementation in Downloads
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0806 Use after free in Passwords
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0807 Use after free in WebAudio
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0808 Integer underflow in WebUI
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0809 Inappropriate implementation in Autofill
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0810 Insufficient policy enforcement in DevTools
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0811 Inappropriate implementation in Extensions API
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0812 Inappropriate implementation in Accessibility
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0813 Use after free in Reading Mode
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0814 Incorrect security UI in Payments
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability CVE-2024-21326: (9.6 critical)
  • Microsoft Edge for Android Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-21382: (4.3 medium)
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-21383: (3.3 low)
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability CVE-2024-21385: (8.3 high)
  • Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-21387: (5.3 medium)

Of the five new vulnerabilities disclosed, they are all marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited and Exploitation Less Likely. See the original Google Chrome security advisory.

#Microsoft #MSRC #securityadvisory #vulnerability #Chromium #Google #Chrome #Edge

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0810 Insufficient policy enforcement in DevTools
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0811 Inappropriate implementation in Extensions API
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0812 Inappropriate implementation in Accessibility
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0813 Use after free in Reading Mode
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0814 Incorrect security UI in Payments
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability CVE-2024-21326: (9.6 critical)
  • Microsoft Edge for Android Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-21382: (4.3 medium)
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-21383: (3.3 low)
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability CVE-2024-21385: (8.3 high)
  • Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-21387: (5.3 medium)

Of the five new vulnerabilities disclosed, they are all marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited and Exploitation Less Likely. See the original Google Chrome security advisory.

#Microsoft #MSRC #securityadvisory #vulnerability #Chromium #Google #Chrome #Edge

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0809 Inappropriate implementation in Autofill
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0810 Insufficient policy enforcement in DevTools
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0811 Inappropriate implementation in Extensions API
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0812 Inappropriate implementation in Accessibility
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0813 Use after free in Reading Mode
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-0814 Incorrect security UI in Payments
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability CVE-2024-21326: (9.6 critical)
  • Microsoft Edge for Android Information Disclosure Vulnerability CVE-2024-21382: (4.3 medium)
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-21383: (3.3 low)
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability CVE-2024-21385: (8.3 high)
  • Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-21387: (5.3 medium)

Of the five new vulnerabilities disclosed, they are all marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited and Exploitation Less Likely. See the original Google Chrome security advisory.

#Microsoft #MSRC #securityadvisory #vulnerability #Chromium #Google #Chrome #Edge

CVE-2023-6332
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

simontsui at 2024-01-25T19:44:52.325Z ##

Sophos reported the discovery of three vulnerabilities in Panda Security software stemming from a false alarm incident:

  • CVE-2023-6330 (6.4 medium) Pool Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6331 (6.4 medium) Out of Bounds Write Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6332 (4.1 medium) Arbitrary Memory Read Vulnerability

These were patched in WatchGuard EPDR and Panda AD360 version 8.00.22.0023, and Panda Dome version 22.02.01. No mention of exploitation.
ðŸ”— https://news.sophos.com/en-us/2024/01/25/multiple-vulnerabilities-discovered-in-widely-used-security-driver/

#Sophos #Panda #WatchGuard #vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-23898(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

Jenkins has a built-in command line interface (CLI) to access Jenkins from a script or shell environment. Since Jenkins 2.217 and LTS 2.222.1, one of the ways to communicate with the CLI is through a WebSocket endpoint. This endpoint relies on the default Jenkins web request authentication functionality, like HTTP Basic authentication with API tokens, or session cookies. This endpoint is enabled

1 repos

https://github.com/jenkinsci-cert/SECURITY-3314-3315

SonarResearch at 2024-01-25T13:55:43.753Z ##

ðŸ”Uncovering critical vulnerabilities in Jenkins, which could lead to RCE (CVE-2024-23898, CVE-2024-23897):

Check out our latest blog post for the technical details on how attackers could potentially gain unauthenticated RCE on #Jenkins

https://www.sonarsource.com/blog/excessive-expansion-uncovering-critical-security-vulnerabilities-in-jenkins/?utm_medium=social&utm_source=mastodon&utm_campaign=research&utm_content=blog-excessive-expansion-uncovering-critical-security-vulnerabilities-in-jenkins-240125-p1&utm_term=ww_en_all_x
